intro: Rostellularia ovata, commonly known as the broadleaf rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, ovate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its botanical features include a woody stem and hairy leaves, which help it adapt to its humid, warm environment. Rostellularia ovata is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist soil conditions.
